title.narrative: Deployment to Interim Haiti Recovery Commission

description.narrative: The Australian Government received a request from the UN Office of the Special Envoy for Haiti, on behalf of the IHRC, to provide a Donor Liaison Officer (DLO) to the Commission for approximately 12 months. The Australian Civilian Corp will provide civilian expertise from the ACC register to undertake the position of DLO in the IHRC for a maximum of 12 months. The specific duties of the DLO position include maintaining a comprehensive understanding of donor portfolios and practices in Haiti, establishing the IHRC donor coordination unit as the primary point of contact for bilateral and multilateral donors and maintaining a working relationship with donors and identifying opportunities for the IHRC to mobilise donor resources for its projects. The total value of this initiative is $0.5 million over 2 years, starting 2010-11.
